words.definition: To allot something means to give it to someone.
words.example: The coach allotted each team five minutes to prepare a strategy.

words.definition: To appall means to horrify, shock, or disgust someone.
words.example: The boy was appalled when he saw the accident.

words.definition: A cache is a hiding place for valuable things.
words.example: The pirates kept their jewelry in a cache hidden in a cave.

words.definition: Convenience is a state of being able to do something with little effort.
words.example: The Internet allows consumers to shop at their own convenience.

words.definition: A dearth is an amount or supply which is not large enough.
words.example: There is a dearth of money in my bank account.

words.definition: If a thing you do is deliberate, you intend to do it.
words.example: She made a deliberate effort to save money each month.

words.definition: When something is dire, it is terrible and very serious.
words.example: The tornado created a dire situation for the small town.

words.definition: To elapse means to pass, as in seconds, minutes, or hours.
words.example: A few seconds must elapse before you can take another picture.

words.definition: Empathy is sharing or understanding another person's feelings.
words.example: The caring nurse had empathy for her patients.

words.definition: When something is fanciful, it is unusual or unrealistic.
words.example: The girl had fanciful ideas about doing well in school without studying.

words.definition: To gripe means to complain constantly.
words.example: Lawrence always gripes when he has to do chores.

words.definition: When something is grueling, it is very hard to do.
words.example: The climber faced the grueling task of reaching the top of the mountain.

words.definition: When something is mundane, it is boring, common, or ordinary.
words.example: The man had the mundane chore of raking thousands of leaves.

words.definition: To opt is to make a choice, especially when deciding in favor of something.
words.example: My brother likes chocolate ice cream, but I always opt for vanilla.

words.definition: Outrage is a very strong emotion of anger or shock.
words.example: Tommy was feeling outrage when his parents said he couldnâ€™t go to the dance.

words.definition: When an amount of something is paltry, it is very small.
words.example: The poor man had a paltry sum of money.

words.definition: To rectify something means to correct it.
words.example: I quickly rectified the spelling mistakes that I had on my essay.

words.definition: When someone is resourceful, they are good at dealing with hard situations.
words.example: Matt was resourceful enough to build a raft after his boat sunk.

words.definition: Sustenance is food and water needed to keep a person, animal, or plant alive.
words.example: Without the proper sustenance, the man will starve.

words.definition: When something is tedious, it is long, frustrating, and boring.
words.example: His job involved a lot of tedious typing and filing.
